t: Jeremiah 46
This*p is the word of the Lord*s that came to the prophet Jeremiah about the nations:
Prophecies against Egypt

About*p Egypt and the army of Pharaoh Neco, Egypt’s king, which was defeated at Carchemish on the Euphrates River by King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon in the fourth year of Judah’s King Jehoiakim son of Josiah:
Deploy*pn small shields and large; approach*ln for battle!
Harness*ln the horses; mount*ln the steeds; take*ln your positions with helmets on! Polish*ln the lances; put*ln on armor!

Why*ln have I seen this? They*ln are terrified, they*ln are retreating, their*ln warriors are crushed, they*ln flee headlong, they*ln never look back, terror*ln is on every side! This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
The*pn swift cannot flee, and*ln the warrior cannot escape! In*ln the north by the bank of the Euphrates River, they*ln stumble and fall.
Who*ln is this, rising like the Nile, with*ln waters that churn like rivers?
Egypt*ln rises like the Nile, and*ln its waters churn like rivers. He*ln boasts, “I will go up, I will cover the earth; I*ln will destroy cities with their residents.”

Rise*ln up, you cavalry! Race*ln furiously, you chariots! Let*ln the warriors march out — Cush*ln and Put, who*ln are able to handle shields, and*ln the men of Lud, who*ln are able to handle and string the bow.

That*ln day belongs to the Lord, the God*s of Armies, a*ln day of vengeance to avenge himself against*ln his adversaries. The*ln sword will devour and be satisfied; it*ln will drink its fill of their blood, because*ln it will be a sacrifice to the Lord, the God*s of Armies, in*ln the northern land by the Euphrates River.
Go*ln up to Gilead and get balm, Virgin*ln Daughter Egypt! You*ln have multiplied remedies in vain; there*ln is no healing for you.
The*ln nations have heard of your dishonor, and*ln your cries fill the earth, because*ln warrior stumbles against warrior and*ln together both of them have fallen.
This*p is the word the Lord*s spoke to the prophet Jeremiah about the coming of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon to defeat the land of Egypt:
Announce*pn it in Egypt, and proclaim it in Migdol! Proclaim*ln it in Memphis and in Tahpanhes! Say,*ln “Take positions! Prepare yourself, for*ln the sword devours all around you.”
Why*ln have your strong ones been swept away? Each*ln has not stood, for*ln the Lord*s has thrust him down.
He*ln continues to stumble. Indeed,*ln each falls over the other. They*ln say, “Get up! Let’s return to our people and*ln to our native land, away*ln from the oppressor’s sword.”
There*ln they will cry out, “Pharaoh*ln king of Egypt was all noise; he*ln let the opportune moment pass.”
As*ln I live — this*lg is the King’s declaration; the*lg Lord*s of Armies is his name— the*pn king of Babylon will come like Tabor among the mountains and*ln like Carmel by the sea.
Get*ln your bags ready for exile, inhabitant*ln of Daughter Egypt! For*ln Memphis will become a desolation, uninhabited*ln ruins.
Egypt*ln is a beautiful young cow, but*ln a horsefly from the north is coming against her.

Even*ln her mercenaries among her are*ln like stall-fed calves. They*ln too will turn back; together*ln they will flee; they*ln will not take their stand, for*ln the day of their calamity is coming on them, the*ln time of their punishment.
Egypt*ln will hiss like a slithering snake, for*ln the enemy will come with an army; with*ln axes they will come against her like*ln those who cut trees.
They*ln will cut down her forest — this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration — though*pn it is dense, for*ln they are more numerous than locusts; they*ln cannot be counted.
Daughter*ln Egypt will be put to shame, handed*ln over to a northern people.
The*p Lord*s of Armies, the God of Israel, says, “I am about to punish Amon, god of Thebes, along with Pharaoh, Egypt, her gods, and her kings — Pharaoh and those trusting in him.

I will hand them over to those who intend to take their lives — to King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon and his officers. But after this, Egypt will be inhabited again as in ancient times.” This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
Reassurance for Israel

But*pn you, my servant Jacob, do not be afraid, and*ln do not be discouraged, Israel, for*ln without fail I will save you from far away, and*ln your descendants from the land of their captivity! Jacob*ln will return and have calm and quiet with*ln no one to frighten him.

And*ln you, my servant Jacob, do not be afraid — this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration — for*pn I will be with you. I*ln will bring destruction on all the nations where*ln I have banished you, but*ln I will not bring destruction on you. I*ln will discipline you with justice, and*ln I will by no means leave you unpunished.
